question: Omni was commanded by his father_____, to write upon the plates to preserve their genealogy.
Omni in his days; would that ye should know that “I fought much with the_____, to preserve my people, the Nephites”.
Omni fought much with the sword to preserve the Nephites from falling into the hands of their enemies, the Lamanites.
Who wrote: “But behold, I myself am a wicked man, and I have not kept the statutes and the commandments of the Lord as I ought to have done”?
Omni was not a wicked man, and obeyed all the commandments of the Lord.
Omni wrote that they had six seasons of peace; and had many_____ of serious war and bloodshed.
Omni only wrote three verses in the Book of Omni.
Who did Omni confer the plates to?
Amaron was the son of what Book of Mormon historian?
Amaron tells us that he wrote only a few words in the book of his father.
And it came to pass that three hundred and twenty years had passed away, and the more wicked part of the_____ were destroyed.
The Lord would not suffer that his words should not be verified, when he said to Omni’s fathers:  “Inasmuch as ye will not keep my _____ ye shall not prosper in the land”.
The Lord visited the Nephites in great_____.
The Lord did spare the righteous that they should not perish.
The Lord did spare the_____ Nephites that they should not perish and delivered them out of the hands of their enemies.
Who was the brother of Omni that he delivered the plates to?
What Book of Mormon historian only wrote one verse in the Book of Mormon?
Chemish wrote that his brother Omni wrote on the plates on the same day that he delivered the plates unto him.
Chemish wrote that he saw the last which his brother wrote, and that he wrote it with his own hand.
What Book of Mormon record keeper wrote only two versus in the Book of Omni?
Who was the son of Chemish, who was also a record keeper?
Abinadom wrote that he had taken the lives of many of Lamanites by using what kind of weapon?
Abinadom wrote that the record of the Lamanites is engraved upon the plates which is had by the kings.
Abinadom wrote that he knew of no revelation save that which has been written, neither prophecy; so he did not write anymore.
What record keeper of the Book of Mormon was the son of Abinadom?
Amaleki was the last record keeper to write in the Book of Omni.
In what book is the prophet Mosiah first mentioned?
Amaleki spoke concerning Mosiah, who was made king over the land of Zarahemla.
In the Book of Omni: What king of Zarahemla was warned of the Lord to flee out of the land of Nephi?
The Lord told Mosiah to flee out of the land of Nephi, and to take as many of the Nephites that would hearken unto him.
Where did the Lord tell Mosiah and his people to go when they fled out of the land of Nephi?
And it came to pass, that Mosiah did not do according to what the Lord had commanded of him.
Mosiah and his followers were led by preachings and prophesyings.
Mosiah and the Nephites were admonished continually by the word of _____.
Mosiah and his people were led by the power of the_____ of God through the wilderness.
Mosiah and his people were led by the arm of God into the land which is called the land of_____.
Mosiah discovered a people who were called the people of____.
When Mosiah arrived in the land of Zarahemla, there was not any rejoicing or happiness.
Who rejoiced exceedingly because the Lord had sent the people of Mosiah with the plates of brass?
Zarahemla did rejoice because the plates conta1ned the record of the Jews.
Mosiah discovered that the people of Zarahemla came out from Jerusalem.
The people of Zarahemla came out from Jerusalem at the time that Zedekiah, king of Judah, was carried away captive into Babylon.
Zedekiah was the king of_____, when he was carried away captive into Babylon.
Zarahemla and his people were brought by the hand of the Lord across the____ waters, into the land where Mosiah discovered them.
At the time that Mosiah discovered them, the people of Zarahemla had become exceedingly numerous.
The people of Zarahemla had had many wars and serious contentions, and had fallen by the_____ from time to time.
The language of the people of Zarahemla had become corrupted; and they had brought no records with them.
The people of Zarahemla did not deny the being of their Creator.
Because of the language that they spoke:  _____ neither the people of Mosiah, could not understand them.
What prophet caused the people of Zarahemla to be taught in the language of the Nephites?
And it came to pass that Mosiah caused that the people of Zarahemla were taught in the language of Mosiah.
After Zarahemla was taught in the language of Mosiah, he gave a genealogy of his_____.
Zarahemla gave a genealogy of his fathers according to his memory.
Zarahemla gave a genealogy of his fathers according to his memory; and they are written but not on the plates of Nephi.
And it came to pass that the people of_____, and of Mosiah united together.
Who was appointed king over the people of Zarahemla and of the people of Mosiah?
In the days of Mosiah, there was a small stone brought to him with engravings on it.
And it came to pass that in the days of Mosiah, there was a large stone brought unto him with_____ on it.
Mosiah did interpret the engravings on the large stone by the gift and_____ of God.
The large stone that Mosiah interpreted gave an account of_____, and the slain of his people.
The large stone that Mosiah interpreted gave an account of_____ and the slain of his people.
The stone that Mosiah interpreted did not give an account of Coriantumr or the slain of his people.
By what people was Coriantumr discovered?
Coriantumr dwelt with the people of Zarahemla for the space of n1ne_____.
The word moons; only appears once in the text of the Book of Mormon.
In what Book of Mormon book can we find the word Moons?
The Book of Mormon speaks of the Tower of Babel by name.-
Coriantumr’s first parents came out from the tower, at the time the Lord confounded the language of the people
The severity of the Lord fell upon Coriantumr’s people, according to his judgments, which are_____.
The bones of the people of Coriantumr are scattered in the land_____.
In the Book of Omni, what Book of Mormon historian was born in the days of King Mosiah?
What Book of Omni record keeper lived to see the days of King Mosiah and also his death?
Who did the record keeper Amaleki say reign after the death of his father?
Amaleki said that in the days of King Benjamin he had seen a serious war and much bloodshed between the Nephites and Lamanites.
During the days of King Benjamin, the Nephites obta1ned much advantage over the_____ according to Ameleki.
King Benjamin did not drive the Lamanites out of the land of Zarahemla.
The record keeper Ameleki; did not have any seed.
Ameleki testified that he knew King_____ was a just man before the Lord.
Who did Ameleki deliver the plates to? Exhorting all men to come unto God, the Holy One of Israel.
Ameleki wanted us to believe in prophesying, and in revelations, and in the ministering of_____.
Ameleki wanted us to believe in the gift of speaking with tongues, and the gift of interpreting languages, and in all things which are good.
Who is the first person in the Book of Mormon to say? “For there is nothing which is good save it comes from the Lord; and that which is evil cometh from the devil”.
And now my beloved brethren, I would that ye should come, unto_____, who is the Holy One of Israel, and partake of his salvation.
Ameleki wanted us to come unto Christ, who is the Holy One of Israel, and partake of his_____ and the power of his redemption.
Ameleki wants us to come unto Christ and offer our whole_____ as an offering to him.
Ameleki writes that we should continue in fasting and praying, and endure to the end; and as the Lord lives we will be saved.
Ameleki said that there were a certain number of people who went to the land of Nephi, and were desirous to possess the land of their inheritance.
Ameleki writes that the people that went up unto the wilderness had a leader who was a strong and_____ man, wherefore he caused a contention among them.
Ameleki wrote that he had a brother that went with Zefiff and has not since known concerning them or him.
Ameleki wrote that the_____ were full and that he was about to lie down in his grave.
What was the name of King Benjamin’s father?
The strong and mighty man that went up to the wilderness was_____.
